result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Holmes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other suspension
Court approves participation in the DOSAGE Probation Pilot Program and early termination of Probation IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES THE PROGRAM AND ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously on file.
Pay DNA surcharge, costs, disbursments and Supervision fees.
Failure to pay  will result in a civil judgment.
If revoked, Court orders finiancial obligations to be paid from monies taken from prison funds, not to exceed 25%, with unpaid balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.

Remain alcohol free.
Remain controlled-substance free.
Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/ counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment if needed.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Serve first 60 days at the HOC with Huber for work, school and child care.
Good time allowed.
REPORT DATE STAYED TO 05-23-14 AT 5:00 P.M.
Remaining 60 days to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

records.addlTxt: /Granting Credit Towards Condition Time, signed and filed.  Copies sent to Attorney Uller, Agent Salter and the District Attorney's Office.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to JUDGE MORONEY
for review. OS

Defendant Matthew A Holmes in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 and that all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Holmes in court with attorney Joshua Uller.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted same and ordered all conditions of bail to continue.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing before 20 on 3/25/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Matthew A Holmes in court.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel, Joshua Uller appeared by phone.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Holmes in court with attorney Joshua Uller.  Josh Mathy for Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 01/14/14. LM
14RM000970  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01-03-2014

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew A Holmes in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-7-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
